intro: Chrysanthemum maximoviczii, commonly known as the Siberian chrysanthemum, is a herbaceous perennial native to eastern Asia. It features finely divided, feathery leaves and produces daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow, white, and pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in cool, moist environments. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine. Its botanical characteristics make it a popular choice for gardeners seeking hardy, decorative plants.
